titleStmt.title: The Spiritual anatomy of man in which is considered I. the happy state of mans integrity in his first creation, II. the woful apostacy of man from God, by his original sin ..., III. mans restoration by ... Jesus Christ, and the excellency of the Covenant of Grace, IV. the whole series of Christian duties ..., V. the particular cases of affliction, especially spiritual defection ..., VI. the great encouragement to believers, for patience and perseverance ... : to which is added an index of the whole contents / published by Andrew Burnet ...
titleStmt.author: Burnet, A. (Andrew)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.S., and are to be sold by John Lawrence ...,

notesStmt.note: Burnet states he published this work, entitled by its anonymous author The anatomy of man. Cf. Epistle dedicatory. It was republished as: Anatomy spiritualized. 1696.
Reproduction of original in Princeton Theological Seminary Library.
